text: James Madison Lee (October 15, 1926 - September 11, 2017) was a lieutenant general in the United States Army. He served as commander of United States Army Pacific (Western Command) from 1983 until his retirement in 1985. Lee also served in the Vietnam War and Korean War, commanding infantry in each. He was born in Wilmington, North Carolina. He retired in 1985. Lee died of complications from dementia on September 11, 2017 in Wilmington at the age of 90.Lieutenant General James Madison Lee, U.S. Army (Retired) ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Disease-related deaths in North Carolina Category:Military people from North Carolina Category:People from Wilmington, North Carolina
title: James Madison Lee
